rComments: Hi, I had Richard Kil for thermodynamics and Quantum Mechanics 2. In both classes, he went above and beyond to try to teach the material in the clearest way possible. Additionally, he made it difficult enough to not slack off, and really focus on learning the material. He is BY FAR the best prof I've had, and he inspired me to do research in QM.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Lots of homework', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Amazing guy, very accessible outside of class hours and willing to help, but the tests are killer and have very little to do with what we learn in lectures, which are really focused on math/derivations rather than examples and applications. he wasn't really good at preparing us for tests

He's friendly, approachable and is willing to explain things outside of class hours. The main issue was that he wasn't very good at judging the difficulty level of the tests he gave us, and most students were unhappy about that. He's pretty okay as a lecturer, but needs more experience with writing fair tests.

He's a good person, but he cannot teach. He doesn't know how to prepare his students for the tests and only shows derivations in class (which never shows up anyways). He literally re-writes his exact same notes in class (the same ones he posts online) and never does any problems. The labs are very helpful since they bump up the mark.

Lectures are mostly calc-based with no example/application problems, which you're left to do on your own from the text. Tests are difficult and very different from the practice tests he posts. He cares about your understanding but has no idea how to prepare you for his own tests. Labs are keeping our marks up, but no labs next year so :')
